intro: Guettarda rugosa, commonly known as the rough-leaved guettarda, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its leaves are typically rough and leathery, with a distinctive texture. Guettarda rugosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
